result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy David Casanova was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy David Casanova is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy David Casanova was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Jeremy David Casanova appeared from jail. Includes 15CF253, 15TR2608, 15TR2609. Case called at 3:15 pm. ADA Hartung states agreement and recites recommendations. Atty. Smestad confirms. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 15CF253. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2  in 15CF253. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF253 and 15TR2608 and 15TR2609. Sentencing arguments. DE addresses Court. Crt orders:

-18 Days jail. 18 days credit. Time served.

-costs $243.

-DNA sample and surcharge

-apply bond on file

Arraignment on July 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

**AMENDED**

_X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  __ Surety
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2500.00.
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- DE to post $100 today and the $150.00 by June 19, 2015

- De to sign a pre- signed waiver of extradition. 

- DE to varify his address to the St. Croix County Jail by phone every Sat. by 5:00pm 715-386-4752.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Willow River State Park.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Information to be filed today.  Arraignment scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Willow River State Park.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
